benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/customFields/pagination - List custom fields

covered: Valid Request: Several scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC06, TC17, TC18, TC20) verify successful retrieval with default and explicit parameters.
Empty Response: TC07 verifies behavior when no custom fields exist (empty JSON array).
Pagination: Multiple scenarios cover pagination behavior including offset/limit combos, large-volume retrieval (TC02, TC06, TC16, TC20) and edge offsets (TC17).

Query Parameters: Audit param variants (FULL, MINIMAL, NONE) are explicitly tested (TC03, TC04, TC05); invalid values checked (TC11); SQL injection attempt covered (TC14); extra unsupported params ignored (TC15).
Authorization: Missing/invalid token is tested (TC12) to ensure authentication failures produce proper errors.
Error Handling: Error scenarios for invalid params (TC08, TC09, TC10, TC11), service unavailability (TC13), and timeout conditions (TC19) are present.
Concurrency & Performance: Concurrent requests and large-volume scenarios are present (TC21, TC20).
Regression & Compatibility: Regression pagination check (TC22) and backward compatibility (TC23) are included.
Schema & Accessibility: Schema conformance / documented JSON schema checks are included (TC24).
gaps: Rate Limiting: No tests exercise rate limiting or throttling behavior (e.g., 429 responses under heavy request burst).
Caching Behavior & Headers: No scenarios validate caching-related headers (ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified) or conditional GET behavior.
Parameter Type Validation: Missing tests for non-integer/ malformed types for offset/limit (e.g., offset=abc, limit=1.2) and for overly large but invalid numeric formats.
Upper-bound / server-enforced limits: No explicit test asserting server behavior when limit exceeds allowed maximum (distinct from integer-max edge-case) or when limit > default but > allowed max.
Offset beyond data: No explicit test that offset greater than dataset size returns an empty array and does not error.
Deterministic Ordering: No tests ensuring stable/deterministic ordering of results across pages (important for pagination correctness).
Response Headers & Content Negotiation: No tests verifying Content-Type, charset, Accept header handling, Link/next-prev headers or presence of pagination metadata if applicable.
Authorization scope and 403: No scenario for forbidden access (403) or insufficient scopes/roles — only missing/invalid token (401) is covered.
Duplicate / Conflicting Query Parameters: No tests for repeated params (e.g., limit=10&limit=20) or malformed query strings.
recommendations: Add rate-limiting tests: fire bursts of concurrent requests to assert expected throttling behavior (e.g., 429) and verify Retry-After header handling.
Add caching/conditional GET tests: validate ETag and Cache-Control headers on responses; test conditional requests with If-None-Match / If-Modified-Since to assert 304 handling.
Add parameter type/format validation tests: send non-integer strings, floats, and malformed numbers for offset/limit and assert 4xx responses with clear error messages.
Add upper-bound limit tests: verify behavior when limit exceeds any documented or system-enforced maximum (expect 400 or clipped response) and document server max limit.
Add offset-beyond-data test: request offset greater than total items and assert a 200 with empty array (not an error).
Add deterministic ordering tests: ensure pagination returns stable ordered results (e.g., sort by creation or id) so paging across pages yields consistent dataset with no duplicates/missing records.
Add response-header and content-negotiation tests: assert Content-Type, charset, and any pagination headers (Link, X-Total-Count) and behavior when Accept header is different/unsupported.
Add authorization scope/role tests: simulate a valid token lacking required permissions to assert 403 Forbidden behavior and clear error messaging.
Add duplicate/ambiguous-query tests: send repeated query parameters and malformed queries to verify robust parsing and error handling.
